info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 12:52PM EDT until September 07 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Henderson and Buncombe Counties. .SEVERAL INCHES OF RAINFALL THAT FELL THE PAST WEEKEND IS FLOWING IN RUNOFF DOWNSTREAM. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. The river at 12:30 pm Tuesday was running just below the action stage of 10 feet. The river is forecast to drop to 9 feet late tonight. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Action Stage Flooding continues. Butler Bridge Rd. is inundated with up to 6 inches of floodwaters from the French Broad River, forcing road closure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Monday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued late tonight before 1245 AM EDT.
